description: This course introduces students to physical models and mathematical methods that are widely encountered in various branches of engineering. Illustrative examples are used to motivate mathematical topics including ordinary and partial differential equations, Fourier analysis, eigenvalue problems, and stability analysis. Analytical techniques that yield exact solutions to problems are developed when possible, but in many cases, numerical calculations are employed using programs such as Matlab and Maple. Students will learn the importance of mathematics in engineering.
name: ANALYTICAL METH FOR ENG

values.comments: This course introduces students to physical models and mathematical methods that are widely encountered in various branches of engineering. Illustrative examples are used to motivate mathematical topics including ordinary and partial differential equations, Fourier analysis, eigenvalue problems, and stability analysis. Analytical techniques that yield exact solutions to problems are developed when possible, but in many cases, numerical calculations are employed using programs such as Matlab and Maple. Students learn the importance of mathematics in engineering.   Although students stated that notes were long and hard to follow, many also said that the course followed a strict outline regarding analytical methods of engineering.   Students generally enjoyed Dr. Carchidi because he stopped to answer questions, moved slower in lectures, and was very easy to understand. He was the “highlight” of the second half of the course for students, and many felt that he was “always willing to meet to explain the material.”  Students found that class lectures were the main source of material for this subject.

This course introduces students to physical models and mathematical methods that are widely encountered in various branches of engineering. Illustrative examples are used to motivate mathematical topics including ordinary and partial differential equations, Fourier analysis, eigenvalue problems, and stability analysis. Analytical techniques that yield exact solutions to problems are developed when possible, but in many cases, numerical calculations are employed using programs such as Matlab and Maple. Students learn the importance of mathematics in engineering.   Although students felt that notes were long and hard to follow, several agreed that the course followed a strict outline regarding analytical methods of engineering.   Students generally found that Dr. Ayyaswamy moved at a fast pace and was often difficult to understand. Students found that class lectures were the main source of material for this subject.
